{{Short description|US musical group}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Frazier River | image = Frazier River.JPG | caption = Frazier River, 1996. | image_size = | origin = [[Cincinnati, Ohio]], United States | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 1991–1996 | label = [[Decca Records|Decca Nashville]] | associated_acts = Danny Frazier Band, [[Mark Wright (record producer)|Mark Wright]] | website = | past_members = Danny Frazier
Chuck Adair
Greg Amburgy
Brian "Gigs" Baverman
Jim Morris
Bob Wilson }} '''Frazier River''' was an American [[country music]] group formed in [[Cincinnati, Ohio]] in 1991 and disbanded in 1996. The group consisted of lead singer Danny Frazier and five musicians, Chuck Adair, Greg Amburgy, Brian "Gigs" Baverman, Jim Morris and Bob Wilson. Frazier River recorded one album for [[Decca Records]] Nashville and released three [[single (music)|single]]s, two of which charted on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' Hot Country Singles & Tracks (now [[Hot Country Songs]]) charts. ==History== Frazier River was founded in 1991 in [[Cincinnati, Ohio]] by Danny Frazier ([[lead vocals]], [[guitar]]), Chuck Adair (guitar), Greg Amburgy ([[Keyboard instrument|keyboards]], guitars, [[background vocals]]), Brian "Gigs" Baverman ([[drum kit|drums]]), Jim Morris ([[Keyboard instrument|keyboards]], background vocals) and Bob Wilson (background vocals, [[bass guitar]]).{{cite web |url={{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p173317/biography|pure_url=yes}} |title=Frazier River biography |accessdate=2008-07-16 |last= Bush |first= John |work=[[Allmusic]]}} They signed to [[Decca Records]] Nashville in 1996 and released a self-titled debut album for the label. This album produced two chart singles on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' country charts: "She Got What She Deserves" at number 57 and "Tangled Up in Texas" at number 67. ''[[Country Standard Time]]'' critic Robert Loy gave a mostly favorable review of the album, comparing Frazier's "almost operatic" voice to that of [[Gary Morris]] and saying that his "voice even rescues lesser songs" on the album. He cited "Last Request" and "Heaven Is Smiling" as standout tracks.{{cite web|url=http://www.countrystandardtime.com/d/cdreview.asp?xid=1041|title=''Frazier River'' review|last=Loy|first=Robert|work=Country Standard Time|accessdate=2009-08-26}} After Frazier River disbanded, Frazier, Morris and Baverman founded a second band called the Danny Frazier Band, with Chris Goins and Jerry Owen. ==''Frazier River'' (1996)== {{Infobox album | italic_title = no | name = Frazier River | type = studio | artist = Frazier River | cover = frazierriver.jpg | alt = | released = {{Start date|1996|02|27}} | recorded = 1995 | venue = | studio = Javalina Recording Studios, Woodland Sound Studios [[Nashville, TN]] | genre = Country | length = 35:26 | label = Decca Nashville | producer = [[Mark Wright (record producer)|Mark Wright]] | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = | next_year = }} ===Track listing=== #"Everything About You" (Jim Daddario, Greg Barnhill) – 4:32 #"That's Why I'm Here" (Bill Luther) – 3:26 #"Money Don't Make People" ([[Ronnie Rogers]], [[Mark Wright (record producer)|Mark Wright]]) – 2:38 #"She Got What She Deserves" (Jenny Yates, Bobby Fischer, [[Charlie Black]]) – 2:58 #"Last Request" (Mark Alan Springer, [[A. J.
